pullrequest.title: Manager with Camera sensor and example

content.raw:
If I understand correctly,  `find_dependency` wraps `find_package` and passes `REQUIRED` or `QUIET` to match what the user called on `find_package()`. For example if the user does `find_package(ignition-sensors0 REQUIRED)` then this line will call `find_package(ignition-math4 REQUIRED)` too.

I think that shortened example should already work. Instead of appending to variables the libraries use the `target_*()` macros, the `save_image` target links against the `ignition-sensors0` and `ignition-sensors0-camera` targets,  and the project's `*-config.cmake` imports the targets. I put `find_package(ignition-common0)` and `find_package(ignition-rendering0)` in the example because they're used directly in `main.cc` and I want a user to know where they come from.
content.html:
If I understand correctly, find_dependency wraps find_package and passes REQUIRED or QUIET to match what the user called on find_package(). For example if the user does find_package(ignition-sensors0 REQUIRED) then this line will call find_package(ignition-math4 REQUIRED) too.

I think that shortened example should already work. Instead of appending to variables the libraries use the target_*() macros, the save_image target links against the ignition-sensors0 and ignition-sensors0-camera targets, and the project's *-config.cmake imports the targets. I put find_package(ignition-common0) and find_package(ignition-rendering0) in the example because they're used directly in main.cc and I want a user to know where they come from.

pull_request.title: Manager with Camera sensor and example

update.description:
The manager interface is based on on [this wiki page](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GAZ/pages/11599873/Ignition+Sensors) and the Gazebo sensors manager.

The `Manager` loads sensors from an `sdf::ElementPtr` of the `<sensor>` tag. Sensors are loaded dynamically, and there is code in the manager to load built-in plugins to go with the sensors in the 1.6 SDF spec.  The built-in plugins are loaded dynamically (rationale: pay only for what you use, and dogfood the same code which would load custom sensor plugins). The only plugin in this PR is the `CameraSensor` which takes a picture of an ignition rendering scene. Lastly there is a `save_image` example which loads a camera sensor and saves a png.

Some other stuff:

* Added dependency on ignition-common0 for Time
* Lots of CMake stuff, most of it to get targets to propagate requirements to other targets that depend on them
* Use GenerateExportHeader to create a header with visibility macros
* Added interface target `${PROJECT_LIBRARY_TARGET_NAME}_headers` to make it easier to get the include directory for generated headers to targets within this project
* Some cleanup in TestUtils.cmake to link using target names instead of library names where possible


Not done in this PR / TODO for future PRs:

* Port the Distortion class
* More camera parameters via SDF
* Support removing a camera from the scene
* Where do frames come in?
* What to do with `<always_on>` tag?
* How should `<visualize>` be handled?
* Support removing sensors from a manager
update.title: Manager with Camera sensor and example

pull_request.title: Manager with Camera sensor and example

pullrequest.title: Manager with Camera sensor and example

content.raw: This might be wrong, but I think overriding it now allows overriding it in the future without breaking ABI. If it is not overridden, if a user casts to CameraSensor and calls `Init` the compiler would see that CameraSensor does not override the  method and it might de-virtualize the call so it calls `Sensors::Init` directly.
content.html: This might be wrong, but I think overriding it now allows overriding it in the future without breaking ABI. If it is not overridden, if a user casts to CameraSensor and calls Init the compiler would see that CameraSensor does not override the method and it might de-virtualize the call so it calls Sensors::Init directly.

pull_request.title: Manager with Camera sensor and example

pullrequest.title: Manager with Camera sensor and example

content.raw:
I bet it found ignition-math3 instead. A lot of the ignition libraries currently `find_package(ignition-math3)`, which sets the variable `IGNITION_MATH_FOUND`, which causes `find_package(ignition-math4)` in this package to exit immediately, falsely believing it found version 4. You'll need to build every ignition library that depends on math from source, editing them to depend on 4. 

[This PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/178/make-cmake-variables-use-versioned-project/diff) fixes the issue by making the CMake variables match the project name.
content.html:
I bet it found ignition-math3 instead. A lot of the ignition libraries currently find_package(ignition-math3), which sets the variable IGNITION_MATH_FOUND, which causes find_package(ignition-math4) in this package to exit immediately, falsely believing it found version 4. You'll need to build every ignition library that depends on math from source, editing them to depend on 4.

This PR fixes the issue by making the CMake variables match the project name.

content.raw:
We might want to make these `REQUIRED`.

Also might want to something like:

```
list(APPEND @PKG_NAME@_INCLUDE_DIRS ${IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS})
list(APPEND @PKG_NAME@_LIBRARY_DIRS ${IGNITION-MATH_LIBRARY_DIRS})
list(APPEND @PKG_NAME@_LIBRARIES ${IGNITION-MATH_LIBRARIES})
```

The above would shorten the `save_image` example CMakeLists.txt to:

```
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.5 FATAL_ERROR)
find_package(ignition-sensors0 REQUIRED)
add_executable(save_image main.cc)
target_include_directories(save_image PUBLIC
  ${IGNITION-SENSORS_INCLUDE_DIRS})
target_link_libraries(save_image PUBLIC
  ${IGNITION-SENSORS_LIBRARIES})
```
content.html:
We might want to make these REQUIRED.

Also might want to something like:

list(APPEND @PKG_NAME@_INCLUDE_DIRS ${IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS})
list(APPEND @PKG_NAME@_LIBRARY_DIRS ${IGNITION-MATH_LIBRARY_DIRS})
list(APPEND @PKG_NAME@_LIBRARIES ${IGNITION-MATH_LIBRARIES})

The above would shorten the save_image example CMakeLists.txt to:

cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.5 FATAL_ERROR)
find_package(ignition-sensors0 REQUIRED)
add_executable(save_image main.cc)
target_include_directories(save_image PUBLIC
  ${IGNITION-SENSORS_INCLUDE_DIRS})
target_link_libraries(save_image PUBLIC
  ${IGNITION-SENSORS_LIBRARIES})

update.description:
The manager interface is based on on [this wiki page](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GAZ/pages/11599873/Ignition+Sensors) and the Gazebo sensors manager.

The `Manager` loads sensors from an `sdf::ElementPtr` of the `<sensor>` tag. Sensors are loaded dynamically, and there is code in the manager to load built-in plugins to go with the sensors in the 1.6 SDF spec.  The built-in plugins are loaded dynamically (rationale: pay only for what you use, and dogfood the same code which would load custom sensor plugins). The only plugin in this PR is the `CameraSensor` which takes a picture of an ignition rendering scene. Lastly there is a `save_image` example which loads a camera sensor and saves a png.

Some other stuff:

* Added dependency on ignition-common0 for Time
* Lots of CMake stuff, most of it to get targets to propagate requirements to other targets that depend on them
* Use GenerateExportHeader to create a header with visibility macros
* Added interface target `${PROJECT_LIBRARY_TARGET_NAME}_headers` to make it easier to get the include directory for generated headers to targets within this project
* Some cleanup in TestUtils.cmake to link using target names instead of library names where possible


Not done in this PR / TODO for future PRs:

* Port the Distortion class
* More camera parameters via SDF
* Support removing a camera from the scene
* Where do frames come in?
* What to do with `<always_on>` tag?
* How should `<visualize>` be handled?
* Support removing sensors from a manager

update.description:
This is a minimal amount of code to get this library started. It's based on [this wiki page](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GAZ/pages/11599873/Ignition+Sensors). And the Gazebo sensors manager.

The goal of this pull request is to have a working camera sensor. Currently there is a stub camera sensor plugin that publishes an empty image.

Some other stuff:

* Added dependency on ignition-common0 for Time
* Use GenerateExportHeader to create a header with visibility macros
* Added interface target `${PROJECT_LIBRARY_TARGET_NAME}_headers` to make it easier to get the include directory for generated headers to targets within this project
* Some cleanup in TestUtils.cmake to link using target names instead of library names where possible

pullrequest.title: Manager with Camera sensor and example

content.raw:
I recently removed `Camera::ImageDepth` in ign-rendering. In gazebo, we've been mistreating it as number of channels but it's not really what image depth means. For now, you can replace the calculation for `step` with:

~~~
this->dataPtr->camera->ImageWidth() * rendering::PixelUtil::BytesPerPixel(this->dataPtr->camera->ImageFormat())
~~~
content.html:
I recently removed Camera::ImageDepth in ign-rendering. In gazebo, we've been mistreating it as number of channels but it's not really what image depth means. For now, you can replace the calculation for step with:

this->dataPtr->camera->ImageWidth() * rendering::PixelUtil::BytesPerPixel(this->dataPtr->camera->ImageFormat())
